entry.title: LMDB issue for all Web dispatchers after FRUN upgrade
entry.content:
Hi Team,

We have recently upgraded SAP Focused Run system to 5.0 FP01 and after upgrade we observed that for system type SAP Web dispatcher all entries have turned red in data completeness check in LMDB.

Entity type: Technical system

Display Name: Installed Kernel Component

Supplier Name: WebDispatcherInstanceKernel

Please advise. Thanks,

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: LMDB issue for all Web dispatchers after FRUN upgrade
entry.content:
Dear Customer, 

Since FRUN 5.0, after implementing Note 3628411 - Enhancement of SAP Web Dispatcher Data Supplier Completeness Checks, the LMDB now provides enhanced support for detailed data supplier checks specific to SAP Web Dispatcher.

To send the missing data supplier WebDispatcherInstanceKernel, please follow the steps outlined in Prepare SAP Web Dispatcher. These steps will guide you through the process to ensure the required data supplier is correctly configured and sent.

Best regards,
Vera Jiang

entry.title: Re: Replacement for the deprecated catalog тАЬSAP_CMD_BC_BP...
entry.content:
Hi @RyanMuller,

You are right, I have a very similar situation.

The successor apps and catalogs also did not show up in my system. Our landscape is also a 2-system landscape, and we cannot select that scope item either.

I looked into this issue, and I found out that "Activate Features" is needed. However, I have never done it before, so I didn't know the steps.

But while I was doing the research, I found something. I think the new scope item 7MI might be available only in Germany and the U.S. now.
When you open the "Manage Your Solution" Fiori app and go to "View Solution Scope," you can select the scope item, and it takes you to SAP for Me. I was checking the deprecated and new scope items there. Because 7MI seems to have only a few available countries, I concluded that it is not available in my environment yet.

For now, the deprecated app still works, so I was planning to wait and see if SAP would make it available later. If there's an issue with our environments (yours as well as mine), please let me know.

Best regards,
Ryoma

entry.title: Re: Admin User running Canvas report is unable to see Own...
entry.content:
Hi @RishabhGupta19881 ,

Admin user should see all data (including self), please check

If in any one of the roles assigned if Target population is excluding to see self-data. or

Person context might have be applied in report and Distance might be selected as only All Descendants or

If there is any filter applied in report excluding self-data or 

Date options might be some older range excluding self-access

Regards,

entry.title: Re: How to Trigger notification to HR team after all Onb...
entry.content:
Hi @Gopinath,

HereтАЩs my approach so far:

  • Created an Email Category using the Onboarding Content Builder and set the Recipient Builder as Onboarding Role-Based Recipient Builder.
  • Created an Email Trigger using the email category created earlier.
  • Created an Email Template linked to both the email category and trigger.
  • Created a Business Rule where the IF condition includes all the tasks that need to be completed, including custom MDF objects like the Super and Tax forms. Added a condition in the business rule to trigger the email template once all the tasks are completed.

Despite this setup, IтАЩm not receiving the notification email after completing all the steps.

entry.title: SAP Public cloud and Warehouse bin migration object
entry.content:
Hi,

Is creation of warehouse bins supported in SAP Public Cloud with migration objects or is it supposed to update existing bin data_

Warehouse storage bin | SAP Help Portal

In the documentation it says is should be possible to create bins, but we are getting error You cannot create new object in wh...

In migration object template, there is information Note that the storage bin must already exist. 

When the bin already exists in system, and then try to update them,  we are getting error Storage bin already exists.., 

So which function the warehouse bin migration object supports_

entry.title: SAP UX Q3/2025 Update тАУ Part 6: SAP Customer Experience and SAP Concur
entry.content:
This sixth post in my series gives an overview of user experience innovations in SAP Customer Experience and SAP Concur. For SAP Customer Experience, look at the new AI agents and the capability to build custom agents, plus AI innovations for marketeers in SAP Emarsys, and Joule and Ai order summaries in SAP Sales Cloud Version 2.  SAP Concur takes travel planning to the next level with the whole new travel experience, complemented by the new Joule Booking Agent enabling users to use natural language to book a trip.

Before reading this, do read the first blog post introducing the series and providing general information about Joule and central entry points and services, along with links to all the published parts of this blog post series:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update тАУ Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

 

SAP Customer Experience

The user experience highlights I have picked are all AI-related:

  • AI Agents.
  • SAP Emarsys UX innovations.
  • SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 UX innovations.

This news article summarizes whatтАЩs new overall for SAP Customer Experience, beyond UX-related innovations:

  • Connected for Growth: WhatтАЩs New with SAP Customer Experience in Q2 2025.

AI Agents

As I explained in part 1 of this series, AI agents work in the background to give a greatly enhanced user experience. A number of powerful AI agents are available for SAP Customer Experience, via the package Joule Premium for Customer Experience. This blog post and video give a nice overview of three of them in action:

  • AI Agents in Action.
  • Video: See How AI Agents Streamline Customer Service (3:11 min.)

The latest UX innovations are:

  • Shopping Agent for the Shopping Assistant.
  • Digital Service Agent (via Early Adopter Care program).
  • Ability to create custom agents in the CX AI Toolkit.

AI Shopping Agent for the SAP Commerce Cloud Shopping Assistant

The shopping agent helps customers when visiting an online shop: they can simply use natural language to state what they are looking for, and the shopping agent will respond with suitable suggestions. Figure 1 shows an example, where the user starts out by stating that they are looking for shoes to wear for two mile long walks while wearing a suit. Two shoes are suggested, and the user asks which one is comfortable right away, since he doesnтАЩt want a long break in period. The agent recommends one model, and the customer then asks for a recommendation for a belt to match, which the agent promptly gives him.

Figure 1: Shopping Agent for the Shopping Assistant from SAP Commerce Cloud. Alt Text: three screenshots of a tall and narrow screen showing a chat, one for each of the interactions explained in the main text. Each response shows one or two images: in the first case two shoes, then one shoe and then one menтАЩs belt.

Find out more here, and watch the video embedded there to see it in action:

  • SAP Discovery Center: Shopping Agent

Digital Service Agent

The new digital service agent helps to provide your customers with a great user experience, similar to how the shopping agent is aimed primarily at your customers. It enables customers to ask questions with natural language and provides answers based on your companyтАЩs business knowledge residing in the SAP system. Hence, it is able to resolve common inquiries and issues, giving customers a good experience. Furthermore, by freeing up you sales and service team to focus on more complex inquiries, your customers will also receive a better service and hence better experience.

The digital serice agent is currently only available for select customers via the Early Adopter Care program. Figure 2 in the next section shows how these customers can select it in the AI Agent Builder.

Find out more here:

  • SAP Discovery Center: Digital Service Agent.

Create Custom Agents with CX AI Toolkit

You can now create your own custom agents with the CX AI toolkit. Figure 2 shows the start screen for the AI Agent Builder, where you can select тАЬCustom ToolтАЭ to start the wizard which takes you through the steps to create a custom agent.

Figure 2: The AI Agent Builder in the CX AI Tookit for creating custom AI agents or using SAP templates to create AI agents. Alt Text: A screenshot with тАЬLetтАЩs Create AI AgentsтАЭ in large text in the middle below an illustration, below in much smaller text тАЬStart by selecting an Agent TemplateтАЭ. Below that, two rows of three cards representing Agent Templates are shown: Custom Tool, Knowledge Agent, Classification Agent, Digital Service Agent, Q/A Agent, and Shopping Assistant Agent.

Find out more here:

  • Documentation: Create a Custom AI Agent.

Further Information on AI Agents for SAP Customer Experience

For a deeper understanding of the power of these AI agents, have a look at this longer video:

  • Video: SAP CX AI Toolkit: AI Insights Agents for SAP C4C & Shopping Assistant | Product Inspiration Series (32:21 min.)

SAP Emarsys

AI-Assisted Report Builder using Natural Language

You can now easily create a report using natural language to describe what you are interested in. Figure 3 shows an example of the entry screen. At the bottom you see hints on what kind of queries you can enter.

Figure 3: AI-assisted report builder in SAP Emarsys. Alt Text: A screenshot with тАЬUnlock the Power of Data with the AI-assisted Report BuilderтАЭ in the middle. At the top a text entry field containing the query тАЬWhat are the Sent, Delivered, Bounced, Opened, Clicked, Purchased, Unsubscribed, Complained for my Email campaigns in the past month?тАЭ, to the right an AI button тАЬGenerate ReportтАЭ. At the bottom of the screen two example queries are listed.

Once you have created the report, you can easily adjust it using a set of convenient filters, such as the date range as well as the list of campaigns and metrics. Watch this video to see it in action:

  • Video: AI-assisted Report Builder (46 seconds).

AI-assisted Product Finder using Natural Language (Pilot)

Pilot customers can now try out the new AI-assisted product finder, which allows users to search for product to add to marketing campaigns using natural language. Figure 4 shows an example of how to enter your search text, see more here:

  • Video: AI-assisted Product Finder (38 seconds).

Figure 4: AI-assisted product finder available to SAP Emarsys pilot customers. Alt Text: A screenshot showing a screen with a left half containing the Product Finder, with a search field containing тАЬMost popular shoes in the last 6 monthтАЭ, above an empty space with the text тАЬWelcome to Product Finder!тАЭ in the middle. The right half shows an image of someone dancing in the sun and an image of a dress, along with some describing text.

Read more about latest SAP Emarsys innovations here:

  • SAP Emarsys Q2 2025 Product Release.
  • SAP Emarsys introduces new generative AI capabilities in June Product Release

SAP Sales Cloud Version 2

Joule in SAP Sales Cloud

Joule is now available in SAP Sale Cloud Verion 2, helping users get quick insights, for example about an account. As you can see in Figure 5, these insights can be charts as well as text based.

Figure 5: Joule for SAP Sales Cloud Version 2. Alt Text: A screenshot of Joule showing Customer Account Overview, with the text тАЬShow Key MetricsтАЭ entered as chat, below which a card with a vertical stacked bar chart shows credit limit usage (remaining amount and exposure amount), below that a card showing Key Metrics (Activity) and part of a donut chart for Tasks, Phone Calls, Appointments, Visits etc.

Have a deeper look here:

  • Video: Intelligent Selling with Joule in SAP Sales Cloud & SAP S/4HANA Cloud | Product Inspiration Series (16:04 min.)

Sales Order Summary

The Sales Order Summary uses generative AI to summarize key information about the sales order, as well as including information about some changes, for example how the price compares to the original price. Figure 6 shows an example, with the insights shown on the left of the screen.

Figure 6: Sales Order Summary in SAP Sales Cloud Version 2. Alt Text: A screenshot showing a sales order, with the left third showing an overview with AI-generated insights such as тАЬ13 days past requested dateтАЭ, тАЬOverall discount is EUR 808.55тАЭ. On the right, the Order Summary tab is shown, with account name, net and gross value, pricing stats, above тАЬProducts in Cart (2)тАЭ showing a list of two products, followed by the top part of a list of pricing steps.

Learn more here:

  • Documentation: Sales Order Summary.

 

SAP Concur

The new Concur Travel experience makes it much easier to book travel involving multiple bookings, such as a flight plus hotel plus rental car. And if you just need to book one item, you can do that very easily now with the new Booking Agent powered by Joule.

New Concur Travel Experience

When travelling for a few days, one often needs to book more than one item. A typical combination is booking a flight, a hotel and a rental car. Up until now, you have had to book each item separately and take care that the dates and time match. Now, with the new Concur Travel experience, planning and booking is much easier: you can enter the start and end dates for your flight, and the new feature Match Flight Booking is applied to the hotel and car, so that dates and time match automatically.

Figures 7 to 11 show what this looks like: Figure 7 shows the start screen, where you select which items you want to include (flight, hotel, car, train). Figure 8 shows the flight view, where flight dates have been entered. Figure 9 shows the hotel search, with the default selection тАЬBased on flight selectionтАЭ, and similarly Figure 10 shows the rental car search, with pick-up and return times calculated based on the flight schedule. Figure 11 shows the finalize screen, in this case showing that the flight and hotel has been selected but the rental car is still open.

Figure 7: New Concur Travel experience start screen. Alt Text: A screenshot of a pop-over with a large image of a magnifying glass on a globe, above the text тАЬStart PlanningтАЭ. Below that four check boxes in a row: Flight, Hotel, Rental Car, Train, at the bottom тАЬContinueтАЭ and тАЬCancelтАЭ buttons.

Figure 8: New Concur Travel experience screen with flight details. Alt Text: A screenshot showing a trip planning for a Trip to Las Vegas. The left third of the screen shows a list with items Flight, Hotel, Rental Car, with Flight selected. Below the list buttons тАЬAdd to tripтАЭ and тАЬSearchтАЭ. On the right a selector for round-trip (selected), one-way or multi-city, with fields for from / to locations and a date field for the stard and end date. To the right a button тАЬTime preferencesтАЭ and a drop-down for selecting тАЬCabinтАЭ.

Figure 9: New Concur Travel experience screen with hotel details. Alt Text: As for Figure 8, but with Hotel selected, and on the right Hotel Search displayed, with the fields for тАЬHotel, location, or nameтАЭ and тАЬDatesтАЭ filled with the text тАЬBased on flight selectionтАЭ.

 Figure 10: New Concur Travel experience screen with rental car details. Alt Text: As for Figure 9, but with Rental Car selected, and on the right Rental Car Search displayed, with the fields for тАЬPickupтАЭ and тАЬDatesтАЭ filled with the text тАЬBased on flight selectionтАЭ and the field тАЬDrop-offтАЭ filled with тАЬSame as pickupтАЭ. Pickup Time and Drop-off Time fields have 10:00 AM entered.

Figure 11: New Concur Travel experience finalize screen. Alt Text: Screenshot showing тАЬTrip to Las VegasтАЭ on the left two-thirds, with a card summarizing the flight with United Airlines from San Antonio, TX (SAT) тАУ Las Vegas, NV (LAS) and a card summarizing the hotel Courtyard by Marriott Las Vegas. The right third shows the Estimated Total Cost $2497.85 above a list with the cost of each item (flight, hotel, rental car), and buttons for тАЬFinalize TripтАЭ and тАЬCancel TripтАЭ, and options to book anything else (Flight, Hotel, Rental Car, Train).

As you can see in Figure 11, another advantage of the new experience is that you get budget transparency at the trip level. Also, you have flexibility to book parts of the travel now and other parts later.

Technically it supports deep linking, which means that you can send a trip-level link to colleagues which includes all the trip parts, making it easy to coordinate trip planning when travelling with others.

To find out more, have a look at the

  • Documentation: Trip Planning in New Concur Travel.

Booking Agent in Concur Travel

The new Booking Agent lets you use natural language to book business travel which is compliant with company policy and budget constraints as well as taking into account your personal travel preferences.

Figure 12 shows an example where the user has simply stated тАЬI want to book a flight from San Francisco to London on Sept 9th and back on Sept 13thтАЭ. The answer shown takes into account the userтАЩs frequent traveler memberships, flight availability and company policies.

Figure 12: New Concur Travel Booking Agent in Joule. Alt Text: A screenshot of Concur Travel with Joule opened on the right, the content is explained in the main text, with the possible flights listed alongside a thumbnail image representing the airline тАЬjetBlueтАЭ.

Watch it in action and find out more:

  • Video: Concur Travel тАУ Booking Agent demo (2:33 min.)
  • SAP Discovery Center: Booking Agent.

 

Continued soonтАж

I hope you enjoyed this sixth part, covering SAP Customer Experience and SAP Concur, with great new AI-powered user experiences helping users work more efficiently and effectively.

The final part seven is coming later this week, covering latest innovations in UI technologies.

Part 1 of the series lists all the parts, and links to those parts that have already been published:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update тАУ Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

Do keep posting your experiences and recommendations yourself in the SAP Community, with the SAP Fiori and/or the User Experience tag! In case you are wondering how to get a list of the most recent blog posts on SAP Fiori and User Experience in our new SAP Community, use these links:

  • Latest blog posts on SAP Fiori in the SAP Community.
  • Latest blog posts on User Experience in the SAP Community.

entry.title: Links are corrupted within SO10 texts
entry.content:
I have a long text in SO10 which I'm using as a "Terms and Conditions" suffix in a Smartform layout. 
The problem is that 2 web links are corrupted in a way that "https://www.testwebsite.com" looks like "mhttps://www.testwebsite.co".
Any idea how it can be resolved?

entry.title: Re: VFX3 display billing amount
entry.content:
Unfortunately, VFX3 does not show the billing amount by default, and the standard layout doesnтАЩt include that field. You need to go with developing the ALV layout either via User Exit or BAdI

You can work with your technical team to enhance the ALV grid using a user exit or BAdI (e.g., SDVFX) to include the billing amount field. This involves fetching the amount from VBRK-NETWR to fetch the total amount per billing document and injecting it into the ALV structure. Join VBRK with the billing document number (VBRK-VBELN) thatтАЩs already present in VFX3тАЩs internal table. Inject the value into the ALV structure via enhancement or user exit. This ensures you're showing the correct total and avoids the complexity of summing multiple VBRP entries.

entry.title: Re: Is possible to use Tricentis Tosca in SAP CALM?
entry.content:
Hi LucasBeccon,

Yes, it is possible to use Tricentis Tosca with SAP Cloud ALM. SAP provides a smooth, one-click integration between Tricentis and SAP Cloud ALM, enabling customers to leverage powerful test automation capabilities directly within their ALM processes.

SAP Cloud ALM is the new ALM product offering from SAP, designed to support the move from on-premise to cloud. As part of this shift, SAP announced that mainstream support for CBTA will end after 2027. To ensure customers continue to have strong test automation options, SAP partnered with Tricentis.

Additionally, Tricentis can also integrate with SAP Solution Manager for customers who are still using on-premise solutions.

For more details, you can refer to:

  • Tricentis Test Automation for SAP in SAP Cloud ALM
  • SAP ALM Partners тАУ Test Automation

Thanks,

Nilabh

entry.title: Re: Facing issue while assigning automated test cases fro...
entry.content:
Hi SAPSupport,

To assign test cases from Tricentis Test Automation (TTA) to a Test Plan in your SAP Cloud ALM project, you'll first need to ensure the test cases are properly imported and synchronized with SAP Cloud ALM.

This process is handled via the Test Preparation app in SAP Cloud ALM. Within this app, youтАЩll find dedicated actions to:

  • Import test cases from TTA
  • Synchronize any updates or changes to those test cases

Once imported, the test cases will be available for assignment to your Test Plan within the project.

For a complete step-by-step guide, please refer to SAP Knowledge Base Article 3598767 тАФ it covers the integration and synchronization process in detail.

If you've already connected TTA with SAP Cloud ALM, this setup allows for seamless orchestration and traceability of your automated tests directly from Cloud ALM.

Let me know if you'd like help navigating the Test Preparation app or configuring the test plan!

 

Thanks,

Nilabh

entry.title: Re: SAP Cloud ALM and Tricentis TTA - SAP Standard Test s...
entry.content:
Hi SAPSupport,

When working with Tricentis Test Automation (TTA) integrated with SAP Cloud ALM, itтАЩs important to distinguish between whatтАЩs available for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

Public Edition тАУ Pre-Built Content Available

For the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, there are pre-delivered automated test scenarios. These are part of the "Test Automation Tool" specifically designed for the public cloud and are based on the SAP Best Practices from the SAP Activate Roadmap. These pre-built tests can be imported and orchestrated via SAP Cloud ALM тАФ helping customers get started with test automation quickly and efficiently.

Private Edition тАУ Custom Automation with Tricentis TTA

For the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, there is no out-of-the-box pre-packaged test content available at this time тАФ either from SAP Cloud ALM or within Tricentis Test Automation. However, this doesn't limit your ability to automate:

  • You can build your own tailored test scenarios in Tricentis TTA, including support for SAP GUI, Fiori, and custom applications.
  • Once created, these test cases can be synchronized with SAP Cloud ALM.
  • SAP Cloud ALM then allows you to orchestrate test runs and gain centralized test reporting and traceability.

While it's a more hands-on approach in the Private Edition, the benefit is a fully customizable and scalable test automation framework tailored to your specific landscape and processes.

Looking Ahead

Tricentis and SAP continuously evolve their toolsets. While pre-packaged tests aren't currently available for Private Edition, the integration already provides a robust platform for end-to-end test automation and governanceтАФand future content packs or accelerators may become available as the ecosystem matures.

 

Thanks,

Nilabh
